text:
Raskolnikov slurped his soup. 

Nastasya plopped down beside him. 

“Praskovya Pavlovna will complain to the police,” she said.

He scowled. “What does she want?”

“She wants her money and you out.”

“The devil, that’s the last straw,” he muttered. “I’ll talk to her.”

“Why do you lie here like a sack? You used to teach.”

“I am doing…” he replied reluctantly.

“What are you doing?”

“Work…”

“What sort of work?”

“I am thinking,” he said seriously.

Nastasya burst into laughter. 

“Have you made much money by your thinking?” she wheezed.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov is confronted by Nastasya about his lack of action and financial troubles, leading him to defensively claim he is "thinking" as his work.
